content.question: In the Paleolithic cave painting shown from Lascaux, the artist likely used which of the following to color the large reddish area within the horseâ€™s body?

choices.label: An early fresco technique, in which pigments were applied with a brush to a wet surface
A dotted-field technique, in which many dots were applied close together with a wax crayon
A spray-painting technique, in which diluted pigments were blown onto the rock surface
An early printing technique, in which clay slip was applied to the wall with terra cotta stamps

content.answer: A spray-painting technique, in which diluted pigments were blown onto the rock surface

topic.text: 1.2: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Prehistoric Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
